replies.bodyText: It's a plain AsciiDoc concept, so I'd expect it to be fine. But we can merge it without this change, if you prefer, @Naros.
replies.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: Nah I actually think we can merge it as-is.  I think if downstream it is an issue, they can also send us a PR to change it to as they see fit too.
replies.author: Naros

replies.bodyText:
@gunnarmorling @Naros I think this particular image reference might already be broken in the downstream and we just didn't notice it, because the condition hides the image.
One thing I would strongly recommend, however, is to set the imagesdir attribute only at the highest possible level (and thus only in one place), e.g. in the https://github.com/debezium/debezium/blob/master/documentation/modules/ROOT/pages/index.adoc file. This is more DRY and it means we can easily change the imagesdir to be something different downstream (without having to hunt down and edit multiple files).
replies.author: fbolton

replies.bodyText: I agree @fbolton, but I'd probably go one step farther and consider defining these (if possible) in the playbook.yml directly (Antora 2.2 and prior) or antora.yml (Antora 2.3+).
replies.author: Naros

replies.bodyText:
To add to the above, right now we have attributes defined in multiple places:

Individual adoc files
_attributes.adoc, but requires each page to include it for it to work
playbook.yml / playbook_author.yml, but requires managing them across multiple files

In Antora 2.3, we can effectively consolidate all these into one single place, https://github.com/debezium/debezium/blob/master/documentation/antora.yml.  For situations where a build-type (e.g. author mode) needs to override an attribute, we can override it from the playbook perspective still, but that should be the only exception.
replies.author: Naros

replies.bodyText: @Naros, so where does that leave us at in terms of this PR? I'm all for consolidating this, but I suppose it should be done separately. Can you capture all this in the DBZ issue you logged for the Antora follow-up work? Is there anything that needs to be done here right now?
replies.author: gunnarmorling

replies.bodyText: This one is good to go, I'll add this as part of DBZ-1687.
